website_summaries.verdict: The Bonavita Connoisseur is the best coffee maker to buy if you want to brew superb pots of drip and spend less cash.
pros: The Bonavita Connoisseur creates fabulously good pots of coffee for a lot less money
It's compact, easy to use, and has few parts to clean
Its thermal carafe keeps contents hot for hours
cons: It's not as attractive as brewers built by Technivorm

customer_reviews.title: Fatal brewing defect
customer_reviews.text: I have tried two of these coffee makers (one from amazon and one as a warranty replacement). Both machines have a fatal problem: the water only comes out though one or two holes above the coffee, with the result that half of the coffee grounds don’t even get wet. This leads to very weak coffee and wasted grounds—exactly the result i hoped to avoid by buying an expensive, highly rated machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 6 of 11 Faulty Holes In the Shower Heads.
customer_reviews.text: Product returned due to 6 of 11 holes in the shower head not working. Coffee tasted weak and, worse, not hot enough. I would expect better performance and quality from a higher-end device. Attempts to call Bonavita Customer Service Hotline resulted in a myriad of phone loops and directions to complete warranty forms. Sorry but I had this defective product less than 3 days. This tedious warranty process puts the onus on the customer. A few clicks and Amazon is taking care of the matter. Thank you Amazon, you have saved me lots of work!
customer_reviews.author: Log

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee, Fast and Simple
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee maker I have ever used. Looks great, much better in person than the pictures show. Brews fast and hot. Very simple to use which is necassary when I just woke up and haven't already had any coffee. I checked the temps of the water being discharged and It read at least 198°. Built well. All of the issues I heard about the older models have been addressed. I got this to replace my Hamilton Beach that is 4 years old. If your coffee is tasting sour or fruity, it's time to get a better coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Hamburger Chef

customer_reviews.title: this coffee maker makes excellent coffee, for a few months then it stops ...
customer_reviews.text: this coffee maker makes excellent coffee, for a few months then it stops working, it cuts out before finishing the cycle when i tried filing a claim through Bonavita's website, it promised a response but was ignored i called, was sent through voicemail that was ignored THERE IS NO COSTOMER SERVICE when your coffemaker breaks, they will ignore you do not but this coffemaker it is a lemon and you are stuck with it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a No Brainer
customer_reviews.text: This machine makes the BEST drip coffee. The brew is very similar to dedicated pour-over systems like the Hario V60. I use it everyday. Like any stainless carafe you will have to use a cleaning method to get the coffee tannins out on occasion. Eventually, the stains will start to affect the coffee's taste. To clean, I just use a dishwasher pod throw the pod in, pour boiling water into the carafe, and leave it for a couple of hours. The stains will be magically GONE.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it! the BV1901TS brews an amazing cup of ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! the BV1901TS brews an amazing cup of coffee! All previous issues of the 1900 seem to have been addressed, easy to brew, easy to pour, and excellent to taste. So glad I got this over the OXO.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: UNACCEPTABLE:  Completely Failed after 4 months of one pot made daily,
customer_reviews.text: Update to previous 4 star good review of very quick and very good coffee but leaking carafe.....Downgraded to 1 star because the coffee maker completely stopped working after 4 months of very good performance. As of today coffee maker does not work. Press button to start brew and light comes on, one single click is heard and then absolutely nothing. No sound of water heating, no hot water to filter basket = NO COFFEE!!!!!! Filed warranty claim and waiting on response. Regardless of 2 year warranty period, product should function more than just 4 months........................Sadly, I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dayner

customer_reviews.title: Cheap not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: There were so many things I didn't like about this coffee pot! It was a little costly, but the reviews were good. When I took it out of the box, I thought it looked cheap. There is no clock or coffee pot heater, just the thermal coffee pot! weird! also the coffee tasted terrible! Why it's so expensive, I have no idea! This should be the price of a Mr Coffee, which by the way.. makes better coffee than this coffee pot! Don't waste your time!
customer_reviews.author: Nina Vincent

customer_reviews.title: ... very expensive coffee maker that we expected would be excellent. As it turned out
customer_reviews.text: This was a very expensive coffee maker that we expected would be excellent. As it turned out, we were very disappointed. I read the reviews prior to purchase and was told that the carafe had been improved and would keep the coffee hot; it did not. The first cup was hot as expected but subsequent cups were lukewarm. Another disappointment about this coffee maker was the amount of coffee we had to use to obtain the desired strength; twice what we had used in previous coffee makers. All in all, I would not recommend purchasing this appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Dinkler

customer_reviews.title: Not So Hot
customer_reviews.text: I thought the coffee from the first brewed pre-warmed carafe tasted great, however it didn't seem as hot as it should be. After the second carafe, with the same results, I decided to check the temperature. The temperature of the water, as shown on my digital thermometer and measured immediately after discharge into the carafe, was 174 degrees F which is significantly less than it should be. I don't believe it would be this warm if measured after passing through the loaded filter basket, so I doubt the brewed cup of coffee was close to 174 degrees.......returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Died After Six Months; Company Dragging Its Feet on Replacement
customer_reviews.text: This was a great coffee maker for about six months, until one day it simply stopped working. Since it was still under warranty, we contacted Bonavita and they said they would replace it. That was several weeks ago. We have yet to receive any kind of confirmation that a replacement is being shipped to us. It's a shame that Bonavita's quality control and customer service are so bad, because this product really did make good coffee when it worked. If you decide to go with this coffee maker, my advice is to have a backup to use after this thing dies. Or just buy a different coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: N. Busse

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I watched and researched coffeemakers for a couple of years, knowing my Mr. Coffee would die soon. I am an avid coffee enthusiast, worked in a non-chain coffee house in the '90s at the height of the coffee shop boom. I've used various methods over the years and liked the pour-over process. When the Bonavita hit the market I read reviews, articles, etc. and thought I'd try it. I don't care for it. All the idiosyncrasies become annoying, the carafe not fitting with the lid on so the lid or basket needs to be stored separately, the carafe does not hold temperature very long, and the coffee isn't all that great. Yes, that's only my opinion YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: SAR

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I think most of the gripes on this review page are pretty dumb. If you're looking for the cheapest coffee maker with an SCA certification, this is it. The only real negative is the design of the coffee maker requires you to hit the on button when you want to brew the coffee. So, if you were thinking you could get around the lack of programming with a smart plug, it won't work with this design; you can't leave the coffee maker in the "on" position and then supply power to it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: stopped working in just over a year
customer_reviews.text: purchased NOV 2017. FEB 2019 just stopped working. Push the button, the light comes on, it then makes a clicking noise and does nothing. Light stays on but doesn't brew. disappointed given the price and the ratings.
customer_reviews.author: CharNoll

customer_reviews.title: Far from perfect
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace my worn out Cuisinart coffee maker based on reviews. Big disappointment in taste, convenience, temperature control. The Cuisinart made a superior tasting cup of coffee by far. It also kept coffee hot much longer. Brew time is slower with this maker and the basket holds water on the grinds several minutes after it beeps as ready. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of coffee ever
customer_reviews.text: I saw a review of this coffee maker in one of my cooking magazines. It was rated #1. I liked what I read, and also found that the coffee pot I had been using was given an unfavorable review. After just two days I am happy to report that this is by far the best coffee maker I have ever used. I find it easy to use, and clean. I am inclined toward suggesting that anyone who says otherwise is someone who nitpicks and/or is used to having someone else take care of all their needs. Well worth the money. (About the cost of 20 cups of Starbuck's.)
customer_reviews.author: Gabeson

customer_reviews.title: Add a lid to the carafe to reduce heat loss
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker makes great coffee! Like others have said, the carafe does not keep the coffee hot very long because the lid is thin and has no insulation. I always prewarm the carafe then decant it into a Zojirushi stainless carafe to keep warm. Another issue with the hanging basket is that the open carafe of coffee will cool off during the brew cycle. I solved this by drilling a hole into a large Ball jar lid and dropping it into the opening. It works great!. I know I shouldn’t have to add this but the coffee is so good, it’s worth it. Bonavita should think to add a lid if they stay with this design.
customer_reviews.author: BJM

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good tasting coffee, bad karafe lid design
customer_reviews.text: This is made well and makes great coffee. There is one major design flaw I really don't like. You can't have the karafe lid on during brewing and it does not fit on the base when the filter basket is attached. So you have to remove the basket if you want to put the karafe on the base. The karafe pores very nicely with the lid on but terribly when the lid is off, so when you fill the reservoir you have to put the lid and then take the lid off to Brew the coffee and then put it back on again to pour you coffee.
customer_reviews.author: NomadCC

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: After watching several videos I decided on Bonavita coffee maker. I grind coffee beans at home and like both of the Bonavita brewing features. (Regular & Pre-infusion) Regular setting the water drips out of all 11 holes, see photos. The pre-infusion setting the water drips out of the middle hole only. Find this odd that pre-infusion uses only the center hole. It makes very good coffee at a competitive price.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hertz

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker ever!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product for a few months now and I love it! It makes coffee fast and is extremely easy to use. It has one button to start the coffee and it turns off when it is done brewing. Once it is done brewing you simply remove the pot and put the lid on it. When the lid is on the pot, the coffee stays warm for hours! I also love that it doesn’t have a hot plate so my coffee never gets burnt! Cleaning it is just as easy as brewing coffee. I just open the lid on the water tank to let it air dry and remove the basket and throw away the grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: bona vita's  bad model
customer_reviews.text: Had the older 5 cup version.. Except for size, it's was a great maker and pot. But, always trying to improve. A mistake. we decided to buy the 8 cup version. Extra coffee must be a good thing, right? WRONG. It doesn't keep warm for long, certainly not long enough. It pours coffee everywhere. This purchase was a mistake. Had to buy an additional pot to keep coffee warm long enough. Should have returned. Finally, I'm sure this pot comes no where close to holder 3 more cups than the excellent 5 cup.
customer_reviews.author: steve1942

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 1 month - abysmal Bonavita customer service
customer_reviews.text: 28 days of working just fine, the Bonavita coffeemaker died on day 29. No, we didn't abuse it in any way. Yes, it had water and power. It just died. Was advised by Amazon to contact Bonavita. I did; their online system sent me to an online warranty claim. I did that. They said they'd get back to me in 5 days. They did not do that. I called the customer service number they provided; round-robin of messages with no human connection possible. I had filed the warranty claim within the 30-day Amazon return window, but (still waiting) nonresponsive Bonavita took me out of the 30-day window. Fortunately, Amazon's customer service is good (Bonavita's is not).
customer_reviews.author: TerriF

customer_reviews.title: Great Java With a Slight Inconvenience
customer_reviews.text: What a great cup of coffee! If you appreciate the best from whatever you're brewing, this is the coffee maker for you. One small gripe, and while I knew it was the case, the fact that this brews with the lid off the carafe, and once you place the lid on the carafe it won't fit on the holder unless you remove the filter basket is a more significant annoyance, to me, than I thought it might be. It's a small thing, but enough of an annoyance to knock off one star. But it does make a great cup of coffee. Buddy the Elf, eat your heart out!
customer_reviews.author: Cidbearit

customer_reviews.title: The Bonavita 8-cup coffee maker lives up to its reputation.
customer_reviews.text: I usually make 6 cups of coffee and it stays hot enough although during the summer months I drink iced coffee so I'll have to wait and see if it stays hot enough later. The insulated pot is very easy to clean and I didn't have a problem with the pot not emptying completely. It turns itself off when brewing is complete but then if you want the coffee to remain hot you must put the lid on immediately. The coffee it makes is much better than my old coffee maker.I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anamaria

customer_reviews.title: Terrific coffee maker with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: I have used this coffee maker daily for eight months and been so pleased that I have recommended it to others. It is easy to use, makes great coffee, and the thermal carafe kept the coffee hot for a decent time - until now. The lid to the carafe no longer closes and, because it remains open, the coffee cools down quickly. I can't figure out what is broken or stuck on the lid that prevents it from closing. I have tried in vain to get a replacement lid, or even a replacement carafe, but neither Amazon nor Bonavita seems to offer it. So disappointing for anotherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: Gal

customer_reviews.title: Good if you like one cup or drink fast
customer_reviews.text: Had this now for couple months. We bought this because of the high flavor ratings and I can't argue with that. But because it's a thermos style, the coffee inevitably doesn't stay warm enough (I have several cups from morning until noon). And the thermos doesn't pour well without the cover, so using it to fill the water reserve is messy, meaning this unit takes more time and attention than justifies the flavor and price, IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: The FinAddict

customer_reviews.title: Boomer Karen sez “Best Coffee Ever”
customer_reviews.text: After being disappointed by the terrible coffee that cheap coffee makers produce, I turned to America’s Test Kitchen for recommendations. This coffee maker is at the top of their list, I bought it, I use it daily, it makes great coffee. I love that right on the water well it tells you how many grams of grounds to use per amount of water. Easy to clean. Coffee is brewed right into a carafe. If I could give it more stars, I would. If you want nearly perfect pour-over coffee but don’t have the time to do so every day, this coffee maker is your new best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Black Belt Auntie

customer_reviews.title: 2* Must have got a duff carafe - 4* otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as recommended through Wirecutter. Arrived quickly and in good condition. it's a good looking machine. A bit miffed about the design that means you can't get the carafe lid on with the basket in place but the main reason it only get 2* is because the carafe leaks so terribly when you pour it that it just goes all over the counter - I can only imagine I have a faulty carafe but because of the problem with having nowhere to store the lid (and not really needing an insulated carafe) I'll be going for something cheaper with a glass jug. If it didn't leak I'd probably give it 4*
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Your BEST cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea just how bad my old coffee maker was! I had a Mr. Coffee that was crap. I knew the coffee it was making was terrible, but the coffee maker before that was a Gevalia (made by Cuisinart, I believe). I was never unhappy with that coffee, but I had to replace it when it broke. Bought the Mr. Coffee, and quickly replaced that with this Bonavita Connoisseur. After the first pot from my Bonavita, I discovered that the Gevalia coffee maker was OK at best. This thing is amazing. The best tasting cup of coffee I have ever had!
customer_reviews.author: Lyle C Brown

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have had every kind of coffee maker under the sun. This replaced a Cuisinart that only lasted a year. So far we love it. It is only 8 cups but we find it is just enough for my husband to fill his travel mug for the ride to work and then I get 3 decent size cups for myself. It brews in about 7 minutes so it is not a big deal for us that it is not programable with a timer. Coffee tastes great and clean up is a breeze. Really pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: JBR

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of the good reviews and am not disappointed. On the daily I use two coffee makers, this Bonavita and a Black and Decker CM2035B at my office. The Bonavita -Brews coffee WAY faster. In at least half the time. -The coffee taste WAY better. I think the Bonavita maintains the right temp water for brewing and the pour head is much wider. -The carafe is of much better quality. It keeps water hotter for at least twice as long. It hasn't developed stains in it even if coffee is left in for a long time. Also the lid doesnt leak like the B&D. I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Schutte

customer_reviews.title: Perfect coffee in 6 minutes! Redesigned carafe lid does not leak!
customer_reviews.text: 1500 watt heater brews at correct temperature and within 5 1/2 to 6 minutes. There are no other drip coffee makers anywhere near this price range that brew this well. My lid started to leak within 2 weeks like many users reported for the thermal carafe model. The replacement lid they sent has a redesigned gasket seal that does not leak. The carafe does a good job of keeping your coffee hot. I use 12 Tbsps. of grounds to brew an excellent strong full pot of coffee. Brews 44 ounces (1.3 liters).
customer_reviews.author: Eric E.

customer_reviews.title: Also just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Bought five months ago and it just stopped pumping water yesterday morning. From other reviews, looks like a common problem. This is our second machine and the first stopped pumping water too (but after about 15 months). As good of coffee as this makes, can't recommend based upon reliability. Guess we'll find out how the customer service on the warranty is.
customer_reviews.author: RokITman

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: For all of the reviews, thinking this was a superior product, yielding good tasting coffee, and so on... It isn't all that, at all. What's worst, it malfunctioned after less than a year. It will make coffee, then a third way through, it flips off. My husband now has to stand next to it, to keep flipping it back on, 3 times, before it completes making even, just 4 cups.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Autodrip for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker. I have one and have given three as gifts. It has a pre-infusion feature to allow the grounds to bloom, which I love. The water temp is consistently around 205, which is ideal. I love the thermal carafe as it holds heat nicely. Well made. The basket and top are dishwasher safe as well. I've always wanted the Techinvorum Moccamaster but that's just too rich for my blood! This Bonavita makes a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Requires towel under it.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like. But I’m replacing it. Can’t pour water into reservoir without it dripping onto the counter. Also can’t store carafe with lid in holder with basket at the same time. Other than that, works fine. But my countertops are wet...
customer_reviews.author: PWRUsr

customer_reviews.title: Stops brewing mid-cycle
customer_reviews.text: Initially, machine made nice coffee, no problems. After we owned it for just a couple months (and the return window closed ...) the thing started shutting down midway through the brew cycle - requiring that you hit the brew start button again (and again ...) to get it to complete the cycle. The limited troubleshooting instructions just recommend a cleaning. While we don't have especially hard water (calcium, etc.) we still invested like $30 in various "descaling" products and have cleaned the machine a couple dozen times. Still hangs at least once almost every time. This thing is headed for the trash.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee maker I have owned. Very easy operate. No bells and whistles but who needs that. This makes great, hot coffee and the coffee carafe has great insulation. The only 'inconvenience' is when you put the top on the carafe it can no longer sit on the 'hot plate' because it is too 'tall' so you have to set the coffee carafe off the hot plate. Though again with the top on the carafe stays well insulated.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good, simple coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I need a coffee maker to do - make a good pot of coffee. I prefer more grounds than it recommends, and the filters that come with it get caught by the top clip and can fold down when you slide the filter holder in - maybe other filters don't. But those are about the only things I don't like about it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mcdevitt

customer_reviews.title: Not as well designed as my older unit
customer_reviews.text: Had a lot of trouble getting the top to snap into place. It's on tight now but I worry that when I remove to clean, it may not go back on tight again. They changed the filter from cone to basket style. The cone filter is easy to remove without spilling the grounds. No so with the basket style. I also prefer the old style filter holder that set on top of the pot instead of sliding into a slot that suspends it over the pot. Not as well designed as the old model IMO.
customer_reviews.author: gale4758

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken. And it leaks.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a no frills coffee maker that just makes really good coffee, but this arrived damaged (see photos). The hanging filter basket is cracked. And the carafe isn’t sealed where the plastic handle meets the metal and drips coffee all over the counter (even after the carafe is mostly empty). It’s new so I expect Bonavita will replace but the process to fill out a claim with them is very long and frustrating. I will update the review once they take care of the issues. In the meantime, beware of purchasing over amazon- product may arrive damaged and unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Carafe Does not Keep Coffee Hot
customer_reviews.text: The eight cups of brewed coffee must be consumed almost immediately after brewing, because the metal carafe does not keep the coffee hot. Within several minutes after brewing, the coffee has lost a substantial amount of heat and continues to do so, due to the fact that the carafe appears to be simply a metal container (rather than a glass thermal lining within a metal container) with heat loss noticeable on the outside to the touch. The unit does not contain a bottom warmer that might, at least, keep the carafe and coffee inside at a reasonable drinking temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rosenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Coffee, can't say the same about the carafe
customer_reviews.text: My second Bonavita pot, the first failed after 6 or 7 years. It makes excellent coffee and the only thing that keeps it from 5 starts is the carafe is poorly designed. If I'm making a small pot and want to pour from the open carafe it's going to spill. The perfect dribble pot. If I'm just filling my my mug, I have to screw the cover on the carafe before I can make a neat pour. It also would have helped to have a 2 cup measure mark on the tank. Since it needs an insulated carafee - there is no hotplate, I'm looking for a better designed replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Jacobik

customer_reviews.title: Best Automatic Drip Coffee Maler
customer_reviews.text: This was bought in April to replace a 4 year old Bonavita that I had dropped and cracked the plastic water container. It did an even better job than the original. Recently I had an issue with either the heating element or the wiring -am not sure which. Through the Bonivita website I submitted a form that described the problem. Very easy to do because Amazon has the invoice on file. Several days later the replacement arrived. Great company and great product.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Get this machine!
customer_reviews.text: I had the same Mr. Coffee machine for about ten years before deciding to switch to this Bonavita Connoisseur. It is worth switching to. This machine breaks down for cleaning very well, something most coffee machines are not set up for. The flavor of this is close to that of the Chemex I prefer to use when I have more time and will be drinking less coffee. It’s a smaller footprint than most machines, too. I recommend it! For that matter, my local coffee shop and roasters recommends it, and they know infinitely more about coffee and extraction than I ever will.
customer_reviews.author: TK513

customer_reviews.title: Cheap looking, makes bad coffee
customer_reviews.text: It has the appearance of a 29.95 Walmart special. There is no stop to pour and the filter basket always overflows anytime you brew 8 cups. I purchased this maker because of a positive posting on CNET. However, I found the brew temp to be low, the coffee taste was not full bodied. Definitely not what I would consider to be a connoisseur coffee maker. It’s pretty bad when a Kuerg pods taste better than a premier coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: GunnerTM

customer_reviews.title: Hot coffee and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We had an older version of this pot and it worked great for several years but the carafe failed. We went with the newer model and it make good coffee that is hot. It’s easier to clean that earlier models but the single electric switch means you cannot put it on a timed switch.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dutch

customer_reviews.title: YES
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker for several reasons. It makes a great pot of coffee, there's no burner so it doesn't burn the coffee (the carafe is well insulated so the coffee stays hot), and the water tank is easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Leela Howland

customer_reviews.title: Way too expensive!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes it makes coffee. But you have to wait about 5 minutes for the basket to drain before you remove it. In their defense they say to use coarse ground coffee, but unless you grind your own you can't buy it. It has no timer and you cannot remove the carafe before it finishes brewing. Don't even try to pour coffee until the lid is on tight.Don't understand why a coffee maker with a simple on and off button she cost so much. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Similar to what others have said
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that the reviews I read were just people being overly critical. However, after 3 days of use I can only but agree with the others reviewers regarding the heat retention of the carafe. It stays hot for roughly 45 minutes and then becomes luke-warm for the remainder of the time. If you're looking to have hot coffee for longer than 45 minutes, do not waste your time or money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Agustin Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Brew
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean, and simple design. Makes a fairly quick 8 cup carafe of coffee... less than 4minutes. Carafe keeps the coffee hot as long as you pre-heat the carafe. I like the simplicity of the coffee machine compared to others I've had in the past; i.e. Breville, Mr. Coffee, Cuisinart. I suppose I'd go with a Technivorm if money wasn't a consideration... but honestly this little machine is perfect for our family.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not efficient
customer_reviews.text: Lots of things wrong with this coffee maker 1. Top of carafe only fits with pot off of the stand so it doesn’t store easily at all 2. You cannot pour the carafe unless the top is on or it will spill everywhere 3. If you knock the machine at all after brewing, a lot of drips will come out 4. You have to take out the filter basket to put in coffee and it doesn’t sit flush on the counter. Almost all other machines let you put coffee in without taking out the basket.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Kwi

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after just over a year.
customer_reviews.text: We owned the previous model and LOVED it since 2013. When the glass liner in the carafe busted we struggled to find a replacement at a reasonable price and so we purchased this newer model in January of 2019. Like many other reviewers have reported it stopped working prematurely - the brew would stop and the light would go off either immediately after pressing the button or halfway through the brew. I agree with the review that offers photos of the rusted internal parts. The manufacturer appears to be using inferior parts at the expense of customers. It stinks to have to find another brand, because it made an excellent cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Two

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: After years of using a quick but wasteful Keurig, we decided it was time for a change. Our daughter & son-in-law used this model and recommended it. Our coffee now (we use freshly ground beans) is SO much better! This machine is easy to use, easy to clean, and attractive. The carafe keeps coffee warm for a few hours. But the very best thing is how great the coffee tastes.
customer_reviews.author: bmack

customer_reviews.title: Best flavor !
customer_reviews.text: This makes the best coffee of any pot we have owned. Bought one for the house and the lake house. Some say it's not programmable. How hard can it be to push a button in the morning in order to get the best flavored coffee outside of a bistro? Wouldn't change it for my old programmable if the old one were free!
customer_reviews.author: Ginny J

customer_reviews.title: It leaks!!
customer_reviews.text: I told my wife I was spending 100 bucks on a Connoisseur coffee maker. She told me I was nuts when we can buy one for $19 at the big box store. Well, she can't quit laughing as this thing leaks like a sieve As others have said, the carafe leaks and oozes coffee - not from the lid, but from the seam where the plastic part with the handle and the stainless steel part meet. Unbelievable, in 2020 they can't even make a carafe that doesn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: No need for a Starbucks/coffee shop run with this in your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Coffee tastes great, much better than any coffee maker we have had before (Cuisinart and Keurig included). It is difficult to tell we we're drinking same coffee brand in Keurig. Simple exterior and takes less counter space than Keurig. No desire for a Starbucks/coffee shop run with this in your kitchen!....strong coffee, tastes great black, I no longer add any milk, sugar, etc. to my cup.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Preheat carafe
customer_reviews.text: For hotter coffee preheat the carafe before brewing. This makes a +10 degree hotter brew than starting off with a cold carafe. On the reservoir, next to the cups marks, is the recommended amount of coffee grounds to use in grams. This is a nice touch. Personally I use 66 grams per 8 cup (40 oz) coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Mikë

customer_reviews.title: Great little coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I read all the negative and positive reviews and frankly, I don't get the negative reviews. You don't need to wait for the coffee maker to finish dripping, pull the carafe out and put a plate under the filter basket, and put the top on the carafe right away. Also, the coffee pours from the carafe just fine without the top screwed on. So far this coffee maker has been great, and the coffee hot.
customer_reviews.author: kenlee

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT COFFEE!!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A GREAT COFFEE MAKER!! I love it, it is simple, fast, and the coffee is the right temp. Any coffee tastes better made from this maker. I is easy to use, easy to clean. No frills, but I did not want any frills. I never have set any coffee maker to auto turn on, so, I do not miss that feature. If you want excellent coffee, made at the right temp, and do not want to pay 300$$ for a coffee maker.....THIS IS THE ONE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Smith

customer_reviews.title: Coffee tastes good. Doesn’t stay hot for long.
customer_reviews.text: Makes good coffee. The idea of using a thermal carafe to keep the coffee hot rather than a burner is a good concept, but coffee cools down pretty quickly. Plan on using the microwave if you like you’re coffee hot. Wouldn’t keep me from buying it again tho.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Can't make a bad cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: The taste of the coffee is WONDERFUL--I think it's impossible to brew a bad-tasting cup! I read reviews on CNET and they recommended pre-warming the carafe, which is indeed absolutely necessary (fill it with hot tap water and let it sit for a minute before starting the brew cycle). A couple other noteworthy items: you must use the lid in order to pour precisely from the carafe; it's easier to fill the reservoir using something other than the carafe; the hot water will steam through the top of the unit, so be sure the coffeemaker is NOT under your cabinets when you start brewing!
customer_reviews.author: Kris Bohl Christian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee machine
customer_reviews.text: The flavor of this coffee machine makes is AMAZING! it brings up to temperature and inside the stainless steel thermo makes the coffee hot temperature to last for hours. I would recommend this coffee machine to anyone who loves coffee. Originally I had some hawaiaan vanilla macadamia coffee beans which didn't taste that good with an old coffee machine I had. Once i switched to BonaVita, the aroma of the coffee came out and the taste is just excellent! definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chin

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee cheap build.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this coffee maker based on recommendation from leading cooks magazine. Coffee is very good. Brew time is fast. The construction is cheap and flimsy. The top of the lid pops off easily sending the spring that holds the internal stopper down flying. I had to retrieve it from the disposer. Also, the top of the unit that holds the filter basket attaches with a couple of weak plastic tabs. Often have to reseat it. Manufacturer (Bonavita) needs to make some improvements in design and build. Carafe doe hold coffee at temp very well.
customer_reviews.author: Garret Browning

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee but carafe not ideal
customer_reviews.text: The coffee tastes fine and it brews fairly fast. I like how simple and uncluttered it is. This obviously isn't the end of the world, but the carafe is annoying. If you use it to fill the reservoir without putting the top on (which you won't want to because you have to leave it off to brew), it spills out the side. You have to put the top on after brewing, and it won't fit in its resting place under the basket with the top on. My experience with thermal carafes is they don't keep coffee hot-hot for that long. I think they're just not for me!
customer_reviews.author: CLB72

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Bonavita Coffee maker for about one month. It makes a great cup of coffee and is very easy to use. I do have a few issues with this coffee maker. First you need to put the lid on the thermal carafe to pour your coffee without spilling it all over. Second, I think the design is a little lacking with no place to store the carafe lid when not in use. Even with those issues it still is a very good coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee pot for our household
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a pot that was simple, one touch, no frills but makes excellent coffee. THIS IS IT!!! We have a very strict no tamper or early pour rule, so did not need a drip/brew stopper. Brews quickly, stays hot and cleans easily. It's definitely not for people who need timers/clocks/ or any other bells and whistles. But if your a no nonsense coffee drinker, than you will not find a better pot on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Melina T.

customer_reviews.title: 7 months later and stopped working!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would not purchase this again, so many issues. Large amounts of steam come through the top, damaged my cabinet, moved to another area. The lid has to be removed to brew and doesn't fit if the basket is slid in. I starting using this in June 2018, its Jan 2019 and I am shopping for a new coffee maker now due to the fact it has completely stopped working. Strongly suggest if you are considering this you keep looking for another
customer_reviews.author: Shelli S.

customer_reviews.title: Finally a coffee maker we're happy with
customer_reviews.text: After our well loved 10 year old maker died we went through 2 till we found this one. Easy to use,looks great, nice smaller size, great tasting coffee. Best of all the stay hot carafe, hot coffee without the burnt quality a hour later. And the carafe can go wherever we're having our coffee. Even our son in law was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I did a lot of research, but I missed 2 things about this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is excellent except for the fact that the carafe is very, very difficult to pour out of unless the top is on. This makes it hard to fill the coffee maker with water and is generally annoying when you try to pour coffee. Secondly, there's no timer and no auto stop so you have to wait for the full coffee cycle to run before you make coffee. These issues have all been very frustrating and I regret buying this coffee maker. I've been impressed with Bonavita's craftsmanship so I'm confused as to why these simple things were overlooked in the design. I'd look elsewhere unless you're ok with these limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Jybeset

customer_reviews.title: Simple to operate and consistently great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with product. Coffee comes out with no acidity every time and tastes great. I had previously used a $20 Mr. Coffee machine and this one blows it away. One thing I had to get used to was the level of grinding your own beans for optimal results. I previously used a medium grind on my coffee beans, but this one tastes best with a finer grind. Experiment a bit with different grinds and find the best one that works for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Designed by people that want their coffee room temperature.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad coffee pot. Let me ask you one question for anyone buying a coffee pot with a thermal carafe. ‘Do you want hot coffee?’ If the answer is sometimes then this is the pot for you. You can’t make the coffee with the lid on. You can’t do the brew and walk away for a little bit thing, because you need to put the lid on after the coffee is brewed. A minor step, but a poor design. Everyone else allows you to have the lid on and brew the coffee. Shame this one doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Cockerham

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee pot for perfect cup
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. The first finally gave out after many years. I wasn't sure I would like the new hanging basket but is worked well. Just have to be in the kitchen when it stops dripping so that the top gets put on the carafe immediately. An added feature is that the water reservoir has both number of cups of coffee you want to brew and the amount of coffee to put in the basket for that much water.
customer_reviews.author: GMM

customer_reviews.title: New design is not an improvement
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. liked the first one but the new design is not an improvement. The carafe now loses heat unless you put the lid on quickly but then it drips from the filter. It is easy to dislodge the filter holder when removing the carafe. The carafe collects condensate which drips off after you put the lid on. What were they thinking? Will not buy another one--first one was better.
customer_reviews.author: mxjs

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working 4 months in, no response from warranty claim or customer service
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and figured I'd give this a try anyway. I should have listened to all of the negative reviews on here and saved my money. This coffee maker does brew a good cup of coffee. However, it stopped working 4 months after I received it. I use filtered water and descaled it, which was what the troubleshooting online told me to do. I submitted a warranty claim and heard nothing back. I also tried calling their customer service and also heard nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Miller

customer_reviews.title: Thermal Carafe is TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to upgrade my standard coffee maker and had heard great things about this one with the multiple drips. I was worried about the glass carafe keeping coffee too cold. So thought the thermal carafe would do this... NOPE. A cold thermal carafe with not even an heater plate to keep things warm. The thermal carafe is terrible at keeping the coffee hot,. Brews hot coffee, dispersed into cold metal container.. Luke warm coffee. No idea if it brews better tasting coffee because the coffee is always cold. Can’t wait to go home to my cusinart.
customer_reviews.author: bmurty

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Construction
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Bonavita Connoisseur based on on-line reviews that this was a top-rated coffee maker. However, the quality of the product does not match the $100 price. If I bought this for $50 I would be satisfied as this matches the quality and features. Quality Issues: 1) plastic construction looks and feels cheap 2) carafe materials are thin and poorly constructed 3) carafe does not seal well and occasionally leaks 4) design - cannot pour coffee unless the lid is attached. with the lid attached the carafe does not fit back in the machine unless the brew cup is removed. Bottom Line - I would not buy again unless the price is reduced and carafe is redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: RBsky

customer_reviews.title: It LEAKS ....
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased this coffee maker. It makes great coffee. I love the idea that my hot coffee goes right into the thermos. BUT ... the thermos caraffe LEAKS. Every morning, coffee in the cup and on the counter. A new carafe is $40. Come on, it should not leak. Right?!?
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Denyes

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: THIS broke in April and I only bought it in January. It has a 1 month return window. What is the point of a one year warranty if there is only a one month return to Amazon? Don't waste your money. This is unfortunately typical of Amazon and the bait and switch policy of their everyday products.
customer_reviews.author: lightworks50

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service wins this review!
customer_reviews.text: *******After filing a claim (emailing a copy of the receipt, video and pictures with the claim form) with Bonavita I was shipped a new carafe which works like a charm! 1. Brews an excellent cup of Joe. 2. The Carafe leaks like a sieve! 3. I owned a previous model of Bonavita that ran like a champ for 5 years! I had no issues with the previous model or the carafe. I honestly can't recommend getting this because the carafe leaks so bad! 4. It really is too bad that you can't store the carafe with the lid on in the coffee maker with the filter basket in place. Very poor design.
customer_reviews.author: nybor5885

customer_reviews.title: Poor function for user.  Pouring water and filter folding = unhappy camper.
customer_reviews.text: Must use a separate container to pour water. The regular pot with out a lid goes everywhere. Frustrating. Cannot see the coffee in the filter once the holder of the filter is slid into place. You cannot lift a lid to see if the filter has folded over. Coffee with grounds occurs much too often. I want to return this coffee maker. Not functional. Too frustrating the first thing in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: A good cup of coffee with a couple of minor issues
customer_reviews.text: If they just made it 1/2 inch taller the carafe would have fit under the brewing basket when you screw on the top. Also there is a fair amount of steam right at the end of the brew cycle so don't have it located under your cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: D Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great for Quality Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This machine allows you to do the "cupping" portion of your coffee brewing, brews a quick and tasty pot of coffee, and gives an IHOP style container so that your coffee retains its' heat better until it is poured into your cup. We have had it for a month now and LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian S.

customer_reviews.title: Leaky carafe!
customer_reviews.text: After fiddling a bit with the grind size, we have figured out how to make a cup that suits our taste. We like the machine! But the carafe leaks and oozes coffee - not from the lid, but from the seam where the plastic part with the handle and the stainless steel part meet. It's a mess, pudding around the bottom of the pot and running out the seam when we pour. Called Bonavita - can't talk to a real person, they tell you to fill out a warranty form and they'll get back with you via email. I sure hope they do.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: 8 months and broken. No help from customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker was great for 8 months. It then began failing - only brewing 2oz of water at a time. It had to be restarted 4 times to brew one pot of coffee. This maker is still under warranty. I followed all of the recommendations for this issue. No success still not working. I then followed all of the instructions to submit a warranty claim. I’ve heard nothing. I’ve submitted information via email 2 times and have called as well (never actually getting to speak to a human). I do not recommend this coffee maker as the customer service fails to actually help a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Brewed Coffee
customer_reviews.text: We went with the reliable research of America’s Test Kitchen and this was their #1 pick for affordable coffee makers. It did not disappoint! It brews at the perfect temperature with easy measuring instructions, and the result is a perfect cup of brewed coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Quality of product has deteriorated instead of improved.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Bonavita. I purchased this brand based on reviews of temperature maintenance over time. The first model maintained temperature but dripped coffee when pouring. After two years temperature of coffee cooled quickly. Bought the newest model to compensate for defects. Unfortunately it leaks when pouring and temperature maintenance is less than 1 hour. Very disappointed in Bonavita design and manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffeemaker because I don't need a timer, I don't want to turn off a heating pad and I need it done fast in the morning. I just started using the pre-soak feature a d the coffee it makes is even better. For me, this is the perfect coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.author: Amatuer Chef

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee! Poor spout!
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker does a great job at extracting the coffee's essence and flavor. HOWEVER, why couldn't Bonavita design a simple decanter that doesn't spill water all over the place? The plastic rim has a spout but it's inadequate! I see water dribbling down the side of the machine on to the power switch. Over time, this will become a warranty return. I'm on the cusp of returning it to avoid that hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Bittel

customer_reviews.title: Broke down easily and poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker overall brewed well. Simple to use and fast enough. However, didn’t last 8 months and it completely stopped working. Have attempted to contact support multiple times via all the avenues described in their website and not even a response acknowledging they received my claim (product is still under warranty!). If you get one of these, hope it doesn’t breakdown as quickly as mine. Sad thing is the coffeemaker it replaces had lasted over 10 years and was still working great!!! So it’s not because we don’t know how to care for the machines.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee.
customer_reviews.text: The pot I received was not fully put together. The entire top was disconnected from the water reservoir. I tried snapping it back in place but not sure if it will hold. Ran 2 full post of filtered water thru the system...10 min. cooling rest between, then added grinds and made the 1st pot. With 2 full cups left, it began spitting and sputtering . Not good. This is my third purchase. The first 2 lasted a year. It does make great coffee, though.
customer_reviews.author: Ural Rider

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months now. It makes a great cup of coffee. The flavor is great. I love that it blooms the coffee before brewing. It's easy to use and durable. I make coffee every morning with it. I love this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Holman

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this June 24, 2019. It passed away today April 7, 2020. RIP Update: I contacted Bonavita, and today (4/16) they sent me a new machine. No hassle, just forwarded my Amazon confirmation, and they sent me an upgraded model (1900TS). The new model is better in two ways: the pour spout was changed so it no longer slops water on the counter when you fill the reservoir, and the coffee basket sits on the pot which keeps the brewed coffee warm until you put the lid on. Because of these changes and their prompt no hassle replacement, I upped my rating to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Quality is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This coffeemaker came highly rated in a cooking magazine. The quality of construction was very disappointing for the cost. It feels like cheap plastic except for the carafe. I did not notice any improvement in the quality of the coffee. In fact, it required at least 50% more coffee to get the same strength. Yes, I did not get another type of grind, so that will affect the strength. Would not recommend purchasing it, as there are better alternatives at the same cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee, with a leaky carafe.
customer_reviews.text: This coffeemaker makes excellent coffee. That water gets hot quickly, the showerhead works well. The bloom feature is nice and really makes a difference. The carafe keeps the coffee warm long enough for me to leisurely drink it all. The main issue I have with it is that the carafe leaks. Not from the spout, but from the joint where the two materials meet even if the spout is not open. You can see it in the picture. It is pretty annoying because I need a paper towel around always. I am going to try to see about getting a replacement via warranty, I hope it is just a defect in my product.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Wotkun

customer_reviews.title: What the picture doesn't show you
customer_reviews.text: What the picture doesn't show you is the lid of the carafe doesn't fit under the coffee basket so smooth storage is not convenient. The top also shifted, does not look very secure. Overpriced with poor design
customer_reviews.author: ASilRobbs

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor and quick brew
customer_reviews.text: Brews hot coffee fast, the carafe keeps the coffee hot, I like to dump the coffee grounds right away rather than have them sit and rot until the next day. Clean and tidy coffee station.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: My second one. Lost mine in a house fire and replaced it because it make a superior cup. Revised to a 1 star. It is May 2020... this was bought Sept 25 2019 and it will not put water thru.... just happened over night. It is not scale. AND even though still under warranty we still have not received a replacement (June 22, 2020). Terrible company!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sissy D.

customer_reviews.title: Happy amateur
customer_reviews.text: This coffee just makes me happy. I'm by no means an expert, but the pre-infused grounds do make a difference to me, and it has created, every time I brew with it, the best cup of coffee I've ever made, and bordering the best cup I've ever had. Very happy with the simplicity of the machine, and it's easy to use, clean, repeat. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KHutch18

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker brews a great cup of coffee. It is close to the quality of the manual pour-over coffee taste without all the time and effort associated with the pour over. Although I enjoy having the ability to use the "pour over" when I buy expensive high quality coffee beans, I knew that realistically I would not always have the time to do this every morning. So, I was looking for a quality coffeemaker that was not too expensive or elaborate, just able to provide a smooth, rich coffee flavor. This one is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
